verses.kjv: These are the words of the covenant, which the LORD commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, beside the covenant which he made with them in Horeb.
verses.ct: These are the terms of the covenant that the LORD instructed Moses to establish with the people of Israel in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant he had established with them at Horeb.

verses.kjv: And Moses called unto all Israel, and said unto them, Ye have seen all that the LORD did before your eyes in the land of Egypt unto Pharaoh, and unto all his servants, and unto all his land;
verses.ct: Moses summoned all of Israel and said to them, "You witnessed everything the LORD did right in front of you in Egypt — to Pharaoh, to all his officials, and to his entire country.

verses.kjv: The great temptations which thine eyes have seen, the signs, and those great miracles:
verses.ct: You saw with your own eyes the tremendous trials, the signs, and those incredible miracles.

verses.kjv: Yet the LORD hath not given you an heart to perceive, and eyes to see, and ears to hear, unto this day.
verses.ct: But up to this very day, the LORD has not given you a mind that truly understands, eyes that truly see, or ears that truly hear.

verses.kjv: And I have led you forty years in the wilderness: your clothes are not waxen old upon you, and thy shoe is not waxen old upon thy foot.
verses.ct: I guided you through the wilderness for 40 years. During that time, your clothing never wore out, and your sandals never fell apart on your feet.

verses.kjv: Ye have not eaten bread, neither have ye drunk wine or strong drink: that ye might know that I am the LORD your God.
verses.ct: You didn't eat ordinary bread or drink wine or any other alcohol — so that you would recognize that I am the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: And when ye came unto this place, Sihon the king of Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, came out against us unto battle, and we smote them:
verses.ct: When you arrived at this place, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan marched out to fight against us, and we defeated them.

verses.kjv: And we took their land, and gave it for an inheritance unto the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to the half tribe of Manasseh.
verses.ct: We took their territory and gave it as an inheritance to the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

verses.kjv: Keep therefore the words of this covenant, and do them, that ye may prosper in all that ye do.
verses.ct: So follow the terms of this covenant and obey them, so that you will succeed in everything you do.

verses.kjv: Ye stand this day all of you before the LORD your God; your captains of your tribes, your elders, and your officers, with all the men of Israel,
verses.ct: Today all of you are standing in the presence of the LORD your God — your tribal leaders, your elders, your officials, and every man of Israel,

verses.kjv: Your little ones, your wives, and thy stranger that is in thy camp, from the hewer of thy wood unto the drawer of thy water:
verses.ct: along with your children, your wives, and the foreigners living in your camp, from those who chop your wood to those who carry your water.

verses.kjv: That thou shouldest enter into covenant with the LORD thy God, and into his oath, which the LORD thy God maketh with thee this day:
verses.ct: You are here to enter into the covenant of the LORD your God, sealed with an oath, which the LORD your God is making with you today.

verses.kjv: That he may establish thee to day for a people unto himself, and that he may be unto thee a God, as he hath said unto thee, and as he hath sworn unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
verses.ct: He is doing this to confirm you today as his people, and he will be your God, just as he promised you and swore to your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

verses.kjv: Neither with you only do I make this covenant and this oath;
verses.ct: I am not making this covenant and this oath with you alone.

verses.kjv: But with him that standeth here with us this day before the LORD our God, and also with him that is not here with us this day:
verses.ct: It is for everyone standing here with us today in the presence of the LORD our God, and also for those who are not here with us today.

verses.kjv: (For ye know how we have dwelt in the land of Egypt; and how we came through the nations which ye passed by;
verses.ct: You remember what it was like living in Egypt, and you remember passing through the territories of various nations along the way.

verses.kjv: And ye have seen their abominations, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were among them:)
verses.ct: You saw their disgusting practices and their idols made of wood, stone, silver, and gold that were among them.

verses.kjv: Lest there should be among you man, or woman, or family, or tribe, whose heart turneth away this day from the LORD our God, to go and serve the gods of these nations; lest there should be among you a root that beareth gall and wormwood;
verses.ct: Make sure there is no man, woman, family, or tribe among you whose heart turns away today from the LORD our God to go worship the gods of those nations. Make sure there is no root among you producing poison and bitterness.

verses.kjv: And it come to pass, when he heareth the words of this curse, that he bless himself in his heart, saying, I shall have peace, though I walk in the imagination of mine heart, to add drunkenness to thirst:
verses.ct: If someone hears the words of this oath and reassures himself, thinking, 'I'll be fine even though I follow my own stubborn desires' — bringing disaster on everyone around him —

verses.kjv: The LORD will not spare him, but then the anger of the LORD and his jealousy shall smoke against that man, and all the curses that are written in this book shall lie upon him, and the LORD shall blot out his name from under heaven.
verses.ct: the LORD will never forgive that person. Instead, the LORD's anger and jealousy will burn intensely against him, and every curse written in this book will fall on him, and the LORD will erase his name from under heaven.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall separate him unto evil out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the covenant that are written in this book of the law:
verses.ct: The LORD will single him out from all the tribes of Israel for disaster, in keeping with every curse of the covenant written in this book of the law.

verses.kjv: So that the generation to come of your children that shall rise up after you, and the stranger that shall come from a far land, shall say, when they see the plagues of that land, and the sicknesses which the LORD hath laid upon it;
verses.ct: Then future generations of your descendants, as well as foreigners arriving from distant lands, will see the devastation of that land and the diseases the LORD has brought on it.

verses.kjv: And that the whole land thereof is brimstone, and salt, and burning, that it is not sown, nor beareth, nor any grass groweth therein, like the overthrow of Sodom, and Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboim, which the LORD overthrew in his anger, and in his wrath:
verses.ct: The entire land will be nothing but sulfur, salt, and scorched earth — nothing planted, nothing growing, not even a blade of grass — destroyed like Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboim, which the LORD demolished in his fierce anger.

verses.kjv: Even all nations shall say, Wherefore hath the LORD done thus unto this land? what meaneth the heat of this great anger?
verses.ct: Every nation will ask, 'Why has the LORD done this to this land? What caused such intense fury?'

verses.kjv: Then men shall say, Because they have forsaken the covenant of the LORD God of their fathers, which he made with them when he brought them forth out of the land of Egypt:
verses.ct: And people will answer, 'Because they abandoned the covenant of the LORD, the God of their ancestors, which he made with them when he brought them out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: For they went and served other gods, and worshipped them, gods whom they knew not, and whom he had not given unto them:
verses.ct: They went off and worshiped other gods, bowing down to gods they had never known — gods he had never assigned to them.

verses.kjv: And the anger of the LORD was kindled against this land, to bring upon it all the curses that are written in this book:
verses.ct: So the LORD's anger blazed against this land, bringing down on it every curse written in this book.

verses.kjv: And the LORD rooted them out of their land in anger, and in wrath, and in great indignation, and cast them into another land, as it is this day.
verses.ct: The LORD uprooted them from their land in anger, fury, and tremendous outrage, and threw them into another land, where they remain to this day.'

verses.kjv: The secret things belong unto the LORD our God: but those things which are revealed belong unto us and to our children for ever, that we may do all the words of this law.
verses.ct: The hidden things belong to the LORD our God, but the things that have been revealed belong to us and to our descendants forever, so that we may follow every word of this law.
